tasks: Automated extraction of capacitive coupling for quantum dot systems
results: Identification of spurious QDs, autonomous flagging of devices with spurious dots
title: Automated extraction of capacitive coupling for quantum dot systems
abstract: Gate-defined quantum dots (QDs) have appealing attributes as a quantum computing platform, however, near-term devices possess a range of possible imperfections that need to be accounted for during the tuning and operation of QD devices. One such problem is the capacitive cross-talk between the metallic gates that define and control QD qubits. A way to compensate for the capacitive cross-talk and enable targeted control of specific QDs independent of coupling is by the use of virtual gates. Here, we demonstrate a reliable automated capacitive coupling identification method that combines machine learning with traditional fitting to take advantage of the desirable properties of each. We also show how the cross-capacitance measurement may be used for the identification of spurious QDs sometimes formed during tuning experimental devices. Our systems can autonomously flag devices with spurious dots near the operating regime which is crucial information for reliable tuning to a regime suitable for qubit operations.
